column4: Is this statement correct?: I am using ubuntu 9.10 it is in gnome enviroment theerefore i cannot install any KDE aplications.
false. I run kde apps on gnome all the time
You can occasionally have a few quirky issues when mixing the 2. but normlly things workj fine
you mean to ask how you can connect to wireless without entering the keyring password?
i got a video of how to set the keyring password to 'empty/change it' at -> http://drop.io/dr_willis
its easier to just show then to explain. :)
I tried over authorisations but i dont know how to
i set my keyring password to be empty that way it dosent bother to ask.. wireless then connects automatically
in my previous instalation be4 crash, there was a box always allow
Is it in authorisations, or somwhere else to do it?
never noticed an always allow.. I just tweak my keyring password. Explore that apps-> acessories -> passwords and keys   tool perhaps
i think i  just found it? yep that was the path. will relogin to see if it works
A+ :) wait till you get my bill.
